favourite.article: It's really well with my soul, in such a turbulent world!
We all have gone through something or someone is going through something, No matter what it is, God's mercy endures, it is ever faithfully, ever sure. Be glad and Rejoice in the Lord.
This hymn is quite soul inspiring and spirit lifting. God bless this ministry. Shalom!
They just don't write them like this anymore. Very rich and meaningful.
How refreshing a song! Praise God that despite the perils, it is well with my soul!

I have lost 5 family members from cancer over the last couple of years. One being my other half. I went to sleep last night feeling sad and lonely. But woke up with the words it is well with my soul. So I typed it in. I listed to the first song that came up. It was the song with the author and his story. I knew then that God was reaching his arms around me. Then I scrolled down and read the comments left. They inspired and feed my soul. I will say when I am lonely and missing my love and family to say "it is well with my soul" and know His love wraps me, His hands carry me, and forgiveness is endless.

This is one of the most inspirational songs in my memory. It was played by a soloist on a saxophone with piano support. It brought tears to my eyes. I printed out the lyrics and again several times it brought comfort and tears to my eyes. Paul, I remembered wrote "Rejoice in the Lord always." This song helps reinforce what he wrote. As do all the testimonials I read here.

When I get overwhelmed with much work as an entrepreneur. When it seems am sure to fail. When the strength and technical know-how fails, I get glued to God & I keep reasuring myself that it is well until the Holy Spirit steps in to do the unimaginable. IT'S WELL WITH MY SOUL. Assuredly, I can never be destroyed.

I kept thinking about my brother who had a really good job but had to resign to go into missionary work...I kept wondering how he was going to cope. I was suddenly overwhelmed by sadness but the Holy Spirit came and comforted me with this song. I have been reassured that it will be fine with him cos it's God who's leading him on, and there is a glorious future ahead. Thanks to hymnal.net for the opportunity to fellowship as we sing along on our devices in different parts of the world and share our testimonies....lets keep on singing. Let's keep proclaiming Jesus as king everywhere, every time and in every way. Praise the Lord!!!

I'm currently on fasting in my list for today I wrote-it is well with my soul, I went through the lyrics and I started to remember how God has been with me losing my sister through suicide and other 3 siblings in a space of 2 years. Then on the 20/04/2014 after fasting my child was comatose the liver shut down. It was hurting so bad that I prayed so hard then the Lord comfort me I felt His hand and this song reminds me of praising through pain. Read some testimonies I'm in tears. May the Lord strengthen all of you.

It has been a very difficult times for me in particular, as well as the entire family. I lost my elder sister on the 10th of this month, on the 16th, my immediate elder sister reported her two girls aged between 10 and 12 years missing in Abuja. By the grace of God they were found the next day by a Good Samaritan, 15 kilometers in Nassarawa State, while we were rejoicing and thanking God for His faithfulness, we got the most shocking news, the next day 17th, of the murder in Abuja of my niece's husband. The family is in shock, all these happening in quick succession, in less than two weeks. The feelings of pain, agony, despondent, but the word of God comes strong, very strong and alive in this situation and times, that He will never leave nor forsake us. This song is all I keep singing, and it lifts my spirit. In all situation an circumstance we find ourself, we are required to always give thanks and praise to God, for He is the all knowing God. He alone is God.

My kid sister was in a terrible accident that resulted in a below the knee amputation about 6 weeks ago and we used to sing the chorus of this song the 1st 3 weeks when it was really hard to deal with and up till now, we receive the unbelievable comfort of the Holy Spirit anytime we are done with singing it. But I decided to learn the entire hymn and I also just read the testimonies in the comment section. Who says God is not alive? Who says He isn't faithful? Let that person come and see!
In any situation we should give thanks to the God almighty. He knows what is good. It might be difficult but we should try and stand firm no matter how big the situation is.
After losing my dear brother in a car accident I couldn't cope until I find this song. I learned to say it is well with my soul in every situation.

I was on the last week of my job, not because I am not doing a good job, but because of status matters, I felt so down and out and I was on my phone and decided to look up the words of this song, as it came to my mind, and I started to sing, it became a blessing to my soul and I know that God is going to provide something better and brighter for me. Thanks for the words of the song.

As a elder brother in the family of four sons and three daughters, today my younger brother was compelled to resign from the job he so much cherished. I googled the song and sang it, that it is well with his soul. I am going to preach in church that for the reason that our Lord Jesus has suffered, we shall not fear to suffer.
Sister Timaru, today I sang this song and then read your comment. Sister I am standing with you. Praise the Lord for the Body. We can experience the oneness.

Today is a very special day for me as it is my birthday and at the same time I received a very alarming news of my husband Etuate and my dear mum who never make it home from the airport after an incident on the road, this song came to mind as I was hoping for peace, I sang it out loud with my two boys under the age of 3 watched me as tears roll down my face...THANK YOU LORD JESUS FOR TEACHING ME THAT IN TIMES SUCH AS THIS I SHOULD CONTINUE TO THANK YOU AND PRAISE YOU AND LEAVE ALL CIRCUMSTANCES INTO YOUR MIGHTY HAND BECAUSE YOU ARE IN CONTROL..AMEN. THANK YOU FOR THIS WONDERFUL, MEANINGFUL UPLIFTIING HYMN. GLORY BE TO GODüíêüíêüíêüíêüíê

I am presently in a situation that I need help from the Lord right now. I have vowed to the Lord to deliver me from this situation and not allow me to be put to shame and I will leave all life meeting His need all around the World. Helping others come out of this kind of problem all life.

This song is helping me as right now I'm facing a very difficult time in my life... I first understood the meaning of this song last year during my first year in varsity while this lady was singing it in church.... It helped me to understand that in everything that we encounter in life it could be good or bad we should always trust and lean on God for He is our rock in times of trouble and also in good times so when we have God in our lives He is not only there just to listen to us but He also take our burdens and make them His so we have every reason to sing and proclaim that it is well with our soul for everything we come across in life we have already won in Christ... As we over com by the words of our testimony... Lets keep on trusting and dwelling in his presence and it shall forever be well with our souls.
This is a song of positive confession, regardless of what has happened, anytime I sing it, there is a kind of an assurance that overwhelms me, and assures me that ALL IS WELL.

When trials and tribulations buffet you know that God has got your back. He is in the midst of everything with you and will see you through the other side. Do not look at the size of the problem but look at the sufficiency and the almighty power of the Lord. Declare It is well with my soul! Amen.

Indeed it is well with my soul. With Christ in the boat I will smile at the storm.He is the captain of the ship. We shall not sink in Jesus Name. Keep trusting Christ Never Fails. Amen. Thanks for uploading this song.
it is well with my soul at all times.
I love the story to this song....I've written a essay on it, a long time ago. I love the words!

I bless God Almighty for the truth of this hymn 341 being unveiled by Racheal given us the history which gave birth to this hymn so we know we are not allow in the trails of our faith, even in our most HOPELESS situation, it is truly well with our soul.

About the author, Horatio G. Spafford:
In November 1873, Spafford decided to take his entire family to Europe for a vacation, intending also to assist Moody in his evangelistic work once he arrived there. However, Spafford was unexpectedly detained in Chicago due to urgent business concerns, but decided to send his family aboard the S.S. Ville du Harve as scheduled. Midway through the trans-Atlantic voyage, S.S. Ville du Harve was struck by the English vessel Loch Earn and eventually foundered. Spafford's four daughters‚ÄîAnna, eleven; Maggie, nine; Bessie, seven; and Tanetta, two‚Äîwere among the 226 who perished in the aftermath. Mrs. Spafford, one of the few who were spared, sent her husband the heartbreaking telegram: ‚ÄúSaved alone.‚Äù
Spafford immediately sailed for England to join his grief-stricken wife. As his ship passed the approximate location where his daughters had drowned, his deep sorrow mingled with his unwavering faith in God's goodness caused him to compose the hymn, "It Is Well."

It is indeed a song of assurance. In time of need and when the worries take up my heart and it looks as if faith is no more there, His gentle voice came and remind me, Whatever my lot in this aging world that "IT IS WELL WITH MY SOUL" and quickly faith takes its place and worries vanished. What a wonderful Friend is Jesus Christ.
We sing this hymn at church, and I think the tune is great, but more importantly the words.

I recently had something unpleasant happen. As I was praying to God a gentle voice whispered, "All is well with my soul." I'd never even heard these lyrics until today. I believe that what God is saying to me is that whatever happens in this life that He's there and He's in control and that He has His hands on us. No matter what we go through in this life, nothing can compare to the glory that awaits the person who belongs to Christ. Because of this promise, we may always, no matter what our circumstances look like, say with assurance that All IS WELL WITH MY SOUL.
Such a powerful hymn. What a blessing and encouragment it is. To know that no matter what circumstances I may be in, IN CHRIST it is well with my soul. He will bring me through victoriously.

I felt a breeze with a voice saying "whatever my lot thou hath taught me to say IT IS WELL with my soul" shortly before I received a call that my immediate younger sister had passed to glory. I find solace singing this song.
The song has been on my heart all morning, I couldn't remember the words so I looked it up. Now I am listening to it. What a blessing.

I thank the Lord for this wonderful and blessed hymn. This is my favorite hymn and I love to sing it over and over again. When my father and mother passed away, we sang this hymn during their funeral. Both of them had receive the Lord. So inspiring, enriching and powerful hymn! When I'm in deep sorrow, distress and trials, through this hymn my spirit is being uplifted and I regain the strength and encouragement I needed. What a Blessed assurance, that everything that happened in our life as a Christian, all is well with our soul! Amen.

We have to remember that death is not a bad thing for a Christian. It means to be done with this world of sin. My son, Saul, died at age 8. He is the lucky one. His two brothers and half brother and sister are all struggling with alcohol, music, drugs, and relationships. Saul was the lucky one. If you have not read the circumstances under which this hymn was written, please find them out. What faith! What inspiration!! Praise God!

I am listening to the song again that the song may not be reserved for the worst of times, but is relevant for the NOW in our lives to build up faith in HIM, but most importantly in developing a resilient lifestyle with deep roots to trust that our lives are in HIM and totally directed by HIM.
I called this song at the Lord's Table meeting this morning. I felt that the song uplifted the meeting. I especially like that all my sins, not part, were nailed to His cross.
I love this song. It was sung at my granny's funeral and I love it now. Thanks for your great ministry. I listen to the music while doing my homework! Thanks again!!

This is a hymn that always touches the inner core of my soul, and encourages me to praise the Lord even during difficult times. It is a hymn borne out of excruciating loss and pain, but also a deep relationship and knowledge of the Lord. It encourages me to declare just like the Apostle Paul " Who shall separate us from the love of Christ? Shall tribulation, or distress, or persecution, or famine, or nakedness, or peril, or sword? .... Yet in all these things we are more than conquerors through Him who loved us. For I am persuaded that neither death nor life, nor angels nor principalities nor powers, nor things to come, nor height nor depth, nor any other created thing, shall be able to separate us from the love of God which is in Christ Jesus our Lord." (Romans 8:35, 37-39)

We would like to borrow the notes in the midst of the lost of our beloved Ericson saying, We are able to maintain our faith in the face of such devastating bereavement without spiritual faltering. As we are confronted with such senseless tragedy would surely be to question, to doubt, to blame, to accuse God. By His grace we have been graced by God to mourn without bitterness, to sorrow without anger, to trust without resentment, to rest in the peace of Christ which surpasses every man's understanding (Phil. 4:6). We maintain the precious faith allotted to all the believers (2 Peter 1:1) which enables us to believe steadfastly that all things work together for good to those who love God and to those who are called according to His purpose (Rom. 8:28).

After being financially strained for the past three months and expecting our first child I thank the Lord for inspiring this song to be written. Often I asked myself why but I understand God has a reason for His glory to be seen all the time. Many have lost their lives during these times but the Lord has been on my side and not a single day have I been diagnosed of high blood pressure or defects on my child or my marriage broken. Thank You Lord.
Every time I sing this song, it touches my deepest emotion, it stimulated my tears of joy to drop, bringing lovely peace down in my heart, all of it because of the LOVE OF JESUS to me. Hallelujah!

Yes, really if we love the Lord then we can only say "AMEN Lord." All things work together for good to those all who love Him (Rom. 8:28). In our own its not easy to accept trials especially when it comes to losing our loved ones. I remember last year in June 2008 my close cousin got sick. His kidney was already acute so all doctors refused to treat him. When it was confirm that he'll no longer be healed unless with miracles all of us at home came to be hopeless. We really can do nothing but to pray. The whole church with other nearby churches prayed for him. During the prayer meeting at home we also prayed and at same time all of us were shedding tears. But we know that we cannot stop what the Lord wants, if that is His will let it be done. What happen should happen. This young brother died at 21 old. His last word before He died is OH LORD JESUS and he breathed his last breath. Although we were not able to witnessed his burial as we live here in Manila, it's all fine. Prayers make us united. Really all is well to our soul. The Lord can bear all things that we can't. I just miss him and I know one day we will be with him and with Christ. Amen.

The Bible says there is no temptation but such as is common unto men but in it God always make a way of escape. The hymn has ministered to me ever since my childhood as we were brought up in a Christian home and always have a hymn for each day. Anytime I remember the song my heart prays and feels for as many as are in one trial or the other needing comfort for their soul. I pray this generation and those to come find solace in God and in His unchanging word of truth. Amen.

Through much difficulty and trial during the last 7 years of chronic sickness hymns like this and Rock of Ages have been of tremendous encouragement to me. I'm in my 30's and have a wife and 2 (soon to be 3) beautiful kids. I can only imagine the grief of losing a child let alone all your children, each is so precious. Praise the Lord that He cares more for our children that we do ourselves. Let us look to Him the Author and Perfector of our faith for eternal encouragement and peace during difficult times and all the more as we see the day of the Lord approaching.

It has always serves as a source of consolation to my soul. I got a deeper revelation about the song when I lost my daughter. I wept like a baby, but a friend ministered to me through this song, and since then, I believe that nothing in this world happens without the knowledge of our heavenly Father. Surely, it is well with my soul.

I really love this hymn because of the message that rings forth! My family has experienced countless trials and yet we strive to count it all joy. One day the perils of this life will be over and my hope and longing is with Christ! Even so, Come quickly! Praise Jesus that my sins have been nailed to the cross and I bear it no more!

My family and I have had many trials in life...this song has made the trails easier to get through...because I always know that Christ is there with me and one day I will be with him...until then it is well...

Recently a friend's husband past and she asked that my mother & I sing this song at the services. And I never thought of this song for this type of service, but it says it all... It is well with my soul! Everyone was comforted by the song and it was a great testimony to everyone there.

I was brought up in the Bible belt in Alabama. My parents did not always agree, hence the three divorces from each other. They even went on to marry others. Mother had three husbands under her belt, one she buried. Father has had four wives all ending in divorces. I married a Navy man. His first ship was the USS Stark FFG 31. That was the ship that was hit by two Iranian missiles. He had gotten off six miths before the disaster. He knew 39 of the 41 killed. His rack was distroyed. Not long after that my husband's mother was diagnosed with breast cancer. It went from one breast to the other, to her lungs, to her spine, and finally she had a brain tumor. I always told her when I talked to her that I was praying for her. She gave me the best compliment. Before she died she accepted the Lord because she said I had witnessed to her by my actions since I had married her son. Mom was dead just after her 49th birthday after a five year battle. Through all this I remember the song saying 'whatever my lot, it is well with my soul.' After hearing the history of this song (which I wish you provided to others), I knew that no matter what happens in my life, God is there to help make it well in my soul. I just have to give it over to Him which is never an easy task. We all want to have that control, but if we give the control to the Lord then He will make it right.
